info.title: xeo4 API
info.description: xeo4 Control API for managing data pipelines

get.summary: Get entity by ID and type

patch.summary: Patch an existing entity (same as update)

get.description:
Lists all files and directories in the specified path (or root data directory if no path
specified). Returns both files and directories with a flag indicating which is which.

Versioned files are stored as: `{filename}/__versions__/{uuid}`
The UI is responsible for aggregating versions for display.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: Optional path relative to data directory (e.g., 'uploads'). Defaults to root data directory if not specified.

post.summary: Save file content directly (without multipart upload)
post.description: This endpoint allows saving file content from a text input.

post.summary: Upload a file to the data directory
post.description:
Files are stored in a versioned structure:
`data/uploads/{name}/{uuid}`

This allows automatic versioning without conflicts.

get.summary: List files available in a connector's object store
get.description:
# Errors
- Connector not found
- Internal server error

post.summary: Execute a SQL query using URL tables
post.description:
# Errors
- Connector not found
- Internal server error

200.description: Query results as Arrow IPC stream

get.summary: Register a connector. Useful when federating queries since registration is lazy
get.description:
# Errors
- Connector not found
- Internal server error

ArrowSchemaOptions.description: Configuration options for moving between internal schema representations and arrow.

string_as_utf8.description: Whether to represent [`crate::values::DataValue::String`] as binary or UTF8

BufferSettings.description: Configuration related to parsing streaming json

arrow_buffer_size.description: Set the size of the arrow buffer before flushing

flush_at_root.description:
Whether parsed nested data should flush rows when returning to the root of the
data

Capability.description: Capabilities a connector can expose to the viewer.

CardinalitySize.description: The maximum key size of low cardinality values

CatalogName.description: Wrapper around a [`StaticStr`] to ensure proper formatting

additional.description: Additional fields to add to schema

exclude.description: Filter fields for schema, pass a regex to be compiled statically

overrides.description: Provide field overrides (from automatic schema creation)

primary_keys.description: List of field names that are primary keys and thus will be forced non-nullable

collections.description: Configuration per collection, modifying the schema of the collection

ConnectionKind.description: Capabilities a connector can expose to the viewer.

ConnectionMetadata.description: Static metadata describing a connector instance.

capabilities.description: A list of capabilities the connector supports.

catalog.description: The datafusion catalog the connector is registered in.

Database.description: Supported databases for the default backend lineup.

default_engine.description: The default table engine to use if not specified for a particular table.

engines.description: The types of tables created, keyed by table name.

order_by.description: Optionally provide order by if the underlying database supports it.

DatabaseOptions.description: Common connection options shared by database connectors.

check.description: Whether the connector should validate connections before use

endpoint.description: Endpoint, url, or path to the database

oneOf.description: TLS configuration if the database requires it

username.description: Username used to connect to the database

DriverOptions.description: Configuration hints and buffer settings for transport drivers

buffer_size.description: Configure the buffer size of the driver's underlying buffer if applicable

max_size.description: Configure the max size of the sources read

size_hint.description:
Identify whether the input is expected to be "large". This is subjective but can
drive behavior in the driver. A driver can choose whether to behave
differently if the expected input size is large, such as trying range requests
in the case of the Http driver.

DynamicConfig.description:
Configuration related to dynamic parsing of data. The "paths" defined represent nested levels of
parent/child data.

name.description: Human-readable name for this dynamic config.

paths.description: A key => value map of how and where in the file data is broken up into collections

root.description: Configure the name of the collection that stores the file information itself.

propertyNames.description: Entity identifier type - wraps String for flexibility with UUID v7 generation. Use the singleton ID '00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000' for singleton entities.

EntityId.description: Entity identifier type - wraps String for flexibility with UUID v7 generation. Use the singleton ID '00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000' for singleton entities.

FileConfiguration.description: File access configuration for File transports

base_path.description: Configure the base path where files are referenced from

cleanup.description: Cleanup any files read from the filesystem

created.description: Creation timestamp (Unix epoch seconds) - oldest version for versioned files

modified.description: Last modified timestamp (Unix epoch seconds) - newest version for versioned files

name.description: File name (relative path from target directory)

versions.description: List of all versions (only populated for versioned files)

path.description: Optional path to list files from (relative to data directory)

full_path.description: Full absolute path on the server

size.description: Size of this specific version in bytes

GetEntityResponse.description: Query parameters for getting a single entity by ID and type

headers.description: Include any additional headers in the requests

oneOf.description: Used when reading ranges if the remote endpoint supports it.

InputConfig.description: The type of input that will provide source locations for Source drivers.

config.description: The type of the input driver

oneOf.description: Read the source locations from a database.

database.description: Read the source locations from a database.

oneOf.description: Run a shell command or script to generate source locations.

shell.description: Run a shell command or script to generate source locations.

oneOf.description: Provide a static list of source locations.

list.description: Provide a static list of source locations.

oneOf.description: Skip generating source locations.

ListResponse.description: Response for entity summary list queries

MigrationConfig.description: Configuration for source migrations during streaming

source.description: A key referring to a source configuration or the source configuration inline.

MigrationDriverConfig.description: Configuration for migration drivers, which read data to generate a schema for the source

config.description: The type of the migration driver

name.description: Human-readable name for this migration driver.

oneOf.description:
Local files, one per table.

NOTE: If the schema is in a single file as "example" data, use `MigrationSource::Json`. This
assumes a DESERIALIZABLE set of arrow schemas.

files.description:
Local files, one per table.

NOTE: If the schema is in a single file as "example" data, use `MigrationSource::Json`. This
assumes a DESERIALIZABLE set of arrow schemas.

oneOf.description: Remote or local file containing full serialized arrow schema

file.description: Remote or local file containing full serialized arrow schema

oneOf.description: Http or File containing json data to parse

json.description: Http or File containing json data to parse

force_parse.description: If true, no stored schemas will be used, parsing will be forced

oneOf.description: Fetch the schema from a database

database.description: Fetch the schema from a database

oneOf.description: Fetch a schema stored in state. NOTE: Not currently supported.

state.description: Fetch a schema stored in state. NOTE: Not currently supported.

MigrationSource.description: Special type of schema source where a file is deserialized into an arrow schema

bucket.description: *Required* bucket name (or base directory for local stores).

from_env.description: Whether credentials should be resolved from environment variables.

ObjectStoreConfiguration.description: Configuration for an object store-backed connector.

format.description: The format to read/write within the store.

store.description: Provider specific configuration for the store itself.

oneOf.description: Apache Parquet format with optional key/value overrides.

parquet.description: Apache Parquet format with optional key/value overrides.

ObjectStoreFormat.description: Supported file formats for object-store connectors.

OperationResponse.description: Standard operation response with ID and optional message

OperatorDef.description:
Internal representation of an [`Operator`]. Used for deserialization and thus is the
format used in configuration. Follow this to see the format used in configuration.

ParsePathsConfig.description:
`ParsePaths` represent parent/child relationships in data.

Configuration for parsing paths in data.

identifier.description:
The path that identifies this *variant* of a schema. When present, this configuration is
identified as the configuration being used for the parsing.

paths.description:
Paths accounting for each "table" the nested data represents, use dot syntax to specify the
nesting path.

ParseValue.description: Represents values for various parsing configuration

oneOf.description: Script settings for the pipeline.

sink.description: The sink configuration for the pipeline.

source.description: The source configuration for the pipeline.

PipelineMetrics.description: Pipeline metrics with separated event channels for UI consumption

PoolOptions.description: Common configuration options shared across connector types.

pool_size.description:
Configure the maximum number of connections to the database. Note, not all connectors
support pools.

filters.description:
The operator to apply

This guarantees the each operator is applied to a unique field

ignore.description: Whether to ignore children in addition to the collection or just collection

QueryRequest.description: Request to execute a SQL query

connector_id.description: ID of the connector to use

sql.description: SQL query to execute (can use URL tables like `s3://bucket/path/*.parquet`)

oneOf.description: Path relative to the cache directory

path.description: Path relative to the cache directory

oneOf.description: Path relative to the data directory (non-versioned files)

path.description: Path relative to the data directory (non-versioned files)

oneOf.description: Path to uploaded file with version resolution support (in uploads/ directory)

path.description: Path to uploaded file with version resolution support (in uploads/ directory)

oneOf.description: Path relative to the config directory

path.description: Path relative to the config directory

RelativePath.description:
Path relative to an app directory (upload, data, config, or cache).

Use this type in configuration structs when you need paths relative to
app directories with optional version resolution for uploaded files.

For paths that are just strings (e.g., user-provided absolute paths or
URLs), use `String` or `PathBuf` directly instead.

SchemaConfig.description: Load schema configuration and overrides for the migration phase.

ignore_saved_schemas.description: Whether to ignore any saved schemas

save_location.description: Where to store generated serialized schemas

variables.description: Variables to be interpolated in various places

Secret.description:
Newtype to protect secrets from being logged
A wrapper type for sensitive string data like passwords.

This type provides protection against accidental exposure of sensitive data
in logs, debug output, or error messages. The inner value is not displayed
in `Debug` implementations.

# Example
```
use clickhouse_arrow::prelude::Secret;

let password = Secret::new("my_password");
println!("{:?}", password); // Prints: Secret(*******)
```

SessionCapability.description: Session capabilities a `QuerySession` can expose to the `QueryContext`.

disable_worker_auto_load.description: Whether the workers should disable auto adjusting

worker_auto_load_batches.description: If workers auto adjust, set the minimum number of unbuffered batches before adjusting

worker_auto_load_step.description: If workers auto adjust, set the amount it adjust by

worker_auto_load_threshold.description: If workers auto adjust, set the threshold of buffered/batches for adjusting

workers_max.description: If workers auto adjust, set the maximum number of workers

catalog.description: Allows specifying a separate "catalog" for management operations and tasks

oneOf.description: List of queries to run after data transfer

connector.description: The connector to sink the data to

manage.description: Allows specifying a separate "catalog" for management operations and tasks

oneOf.description: Any operational tasks that should be performed before sinking data

workers.description: Override the default starting parallelism for sink workers

SizeHint.description: Size hint can be provided by configuration and used by a driver implementation.

disable_default_empty_input.description:
Prevent one empty list of inputs (which is the default) if no inputs are provided. Some
sources may not require inputs to function (like a Database, or set of Parquet files). But
other times you may want an error to occur if the inputs are empty.

input.description: A key referring to an input configuration or input configuration inline

oneOf.description: Configuration for generating or accessing schemas for this source

options.description: Various configurations for an individual source stream

schema.description: Configuration for loading schema overrides for this source

source.description: A key referring to a source driver or source driver configuration inline

SourceConfigOptions.description: Various configurations for an individual source stream

buffer.description:
Buffer the inputs to sources. This is helpful if the individual sources are tiny, which
allows buffering sources into larger `RecordBatch`es which can be more efficient.

limit.description: Limit the number of inputs to be sourced

workers.description: If sources should be run in parallel (the default), configure the number of workers to use.

config.description: The type of the source driver

name.description: Human-readable name for this source driver.

SourceFormat.description: Source drivers that are designed to stream `RecordBatch`es to a sink.

Summary.description: Summary of an entity for listings

id.description: The unique identifier of the entity

TableSummary.description: Lightweight description of a table/file exposed by a connector.

TransportOptions.description: Options provided to transport drivers during runtime

options.description: Options passed to drivers, context dependent

oneOf.description: Read data from a remote HTTP endpoint
Read data from a remote HTTP endpoint
Read files on disk
Read files on disk
Read data from a remote endpoint, download locally, and read from the local file
Read data from a remote endpoint, download locally, and read from the local file

TransportType.description: Configuration for reading byte streams, like files on disk

oneOf.description: Application-managed path with optional version resolution
User-provided external path (filesystem path or URL)

UserDefinedPath.description:
Path that can be either managed by the application or user-defined.

Use this type when a path could be either:
- An uploaded file managed by the app (with version resolution)
- A user-provided path on the filesystem

# Examples
```
// Managed: uploads/config.json (resolved to latest UUID)
UserDefinedPath::Managed(RelativePath::Data(VersionedPath::new("uploads/config.json")))

// External: /usr/local/bin/script.sh
UserDefinedPath::External("/usr/local/bin/script.sh".to_string())
```

VersionedPath.description:
Newtype wrapper for versioned file paths.

Represents a logical file name that resolves to the latest UUID-versioned
file in a directory (e.g., "config.json"  "uploads/config.json/{latest-uuid}").

The inner string is not directly accessible to prevent bypassing version resolution.
